text: Georg Philipp Schmidt von Lübeck (January 1, 1766 – October 28, 1849) was a German poet. He was born in Lübeck as member of a merchant family with long tradition. He studied law in Jena and Göttingen 1786 bis 1790, then he changed to theology and in the end to medicine."Allgemeine Deutsche Biographie", t. 32, Leipzig 1891. In Jena he made friends with the writers Sophie Mereau and Johann Gottfried Herder. After some journeys through Germany he worked as civil servant for the Danish government till 1829. His most famous poem is „Der Wanderer“. It was composed by Franz Schubert. == References == Category:1766 births Category:1849 deaths Category:German poets Category:People from Lübeck Category:Writers from Schleswig-Holstein
title: Georg Philipp Schmidt von Lübeck
